page.title: 19Smarden - Old Age
page.content: Like most country regions, Smarden has many elderly folk, especially widows, living alone. Tough and independent, they are supported by neighbours and families. The council has built small but convenient bungalows much appreciated by the old people who live in them. The Old Rectory, a State home housing 26, was once a rambling house with large rooms which has been converted and enlarged for people who cannot live alone. When death finally comes, parishoners may be interred in the burial ground bought by the parish council when the churchyard became full. Its situation next to the sewage works is by no means ideal, but attempts have been made to beautify it. Cremation is now very common and the parish church has set aside an area for the interment of ashes.
